articles.title: Kim Jong Il Gives Field Guidance to Different Units in Kanggye City
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Gives Field Guidance to Different Units in Kanggye City
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il gave field guidance to different units in Kanggye City.
					The first leg of his guidance was the Jagang Provincial E-Business Institute newly built in Kanggye City.
					
					He went round the exhibition hall of developed programs and other places to acquaint himself in detail with the equipment of the institute and researches there.
					
					He met with Kim Chol Jin, chief of the System Research Room which is developing efficient programs, and other technicians to get familiar with the researches. He was pleased to learn that the graduates from computer genius classes of various schools have grown to be young technicians performing an important role in the field of information industry and said that this proud reality eloquently proves the validity and vitality of the measure taken by the WPK to strengthen the work for training computer geniuses.
					
					He stressed the need to work out a correct plan for developing IT and continue to retain a firm grip on it as the most important affair of the state in order to put all fields of the national economy on an IT basis.
					
					 Noting that what is essential for developing programs is to develop programs of Korean style, he indicated the orientation and ways to do so.
					
					In order to accelerate the IT development, it is important to give precedence to the scientific researches, he said, adding that to this end it is necessary to expand the ranks of scientists and technicians in the field of information industry and rapidly raise their level and strengthen the training of persons of talent in the field of IT, in particular.
					
					The Jagang Provincial E-Business Institute having a solid material foundation and technical forces has a very bright prospect of development, he noted, calling on all the employees to make strenuous efforts to turn the institute into a steadily prospering enterprise.
					
					 The next leg of his guidance was the Jagang Provincial Library.
					
					After going round the room devoted to the history of the library, he dropped in at the newly built Menu Search Room, the Computer-Aided Lecture Hall, the e-reading room and other places to acquaint himself with the equipment and operation there.
					
					Libraries have very important duties and role to play in carrying out the technical and cultural revolutions, he noted, setting forth tasks to be fulfilled to use them.
					
					Dynamic progress made in the cultural revolution has resulted in rapidly raising the cultural standard of the working people to a higher level and increasing their cultural need as the days go by, he said, underscoring the need for the library to have enough books and information of various kinds to provide working people and school youth and children with the information required by them in good time.
					
					 Reading information through a computer network is not only economical but an effective method of enabling a lot of people to read anything in any place, he noted, underscoring the need to expand the computer network even to counties and ris under a long-term plan in the future.
					
					He then moved on to the Kanggye Koryo Medicine Factory.
					
					He went round the interior of the modernized factory to learn in detail about the production there.
					
					He highly appreciated the work style with which the officials and workers and technicians of the factory have made devoted efforts to implement the Party policy, noting that they have successfully realized the process of producing extracted, germ-and dust-free Koryo medicine on a scientific basis and significantly improved the quality of medicine.
					
					Noting that medicine, one of basic means for treatment and preventive work, provides an important material basis for giving full play to the true advantages of the socialist public health system in the country, he called for exerting great efforts for the production of medicine so that the people may fully benefit from it.
					
					He said that it is very important for promoting the health of the people to develop Koryo medicine as it is good drug which has been widely used in Korea since long ago.
					
					He expressed conviction that they would perform uninterrupted miracles and feats in the production of medicine, aware that they are the health workers standing at the honorable post for protecting the people's lives and promoting their health.
					
					He was accompanied by Pak To Chun, chief secretary of the Jagang Provincial Committee of the WPK, Jang Song Thaek, department director of the C.C., WPK, Ju Kyu Chang, first vice department director of the same, and KPA Generals Hyon Chol Hae and Ri Myong Su.

articles.title: New Year Card to Kim Jong Il from Hu Jintao
articles.content:
New Year Card to Kim Jong Il from Hu Jintao
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a New Year card from Hu Jintao, General Secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and President of the People's Republic of China, on the occasion of New Year Juche 98 (2009).
					 Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Liu Xiaoming handed over the New Year card to Secretary of the C. C., the Workers' Party of Korea Choe Thae Bok on Tuesday.
					
					 The New Year card to Kim Jong Il from Wang Jiarui, head of the International Liaison Department of the C. C., the Communist Party of China, and the New Year card and a gift from the Chinese ambassador to the DPRK were also conveyed.

articles.title: Ora Bank Opens
articles.content:
Ora Bank Opens
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- The Ora Bank was opened with due ceremony in Pyongyang on Tuesday.
					 Present at the opening ceremony were O Kwang Chol, president of the Foreign Trade Bank, Sin Pong Ryol, vice-minister of Finance, Kim Chon Gyun, director of the Central Bank, Ri Yong Su, vice-president of the Ora Bank, officials concerned, members of the delegation of the Orascom Telecom Holding of Egypt headed by its Chairman and CEO Naguib Sawiris and Ismail Abdelrahman Ghoneim Hussein, Egyptian ambassador to the DPRK, and Ezzeldin Heikal, president of the Ora Bank.
					
					 Speeches were made at the ceremony.
					
					 O Kwang Chol referred to the fact that the Ora Bank started its business thanks to the cooperation between the Foreign Trade Bank of the DPRK and the Orascom Telecom Holding of Egypt, adding that the bank would contribute to boosting the friendship and developing the cooperation between the two countries in the future.
					
					 Naguib Sawiris said that the bank would help towards promoting the understanding between the peoples of Egypt and the DPRK and developing the bilateral friendly relations.

articles.title: DPRK Government Hosts Reception
articles.content:
DPRK Government Hosts Reception
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- The DPRK government Monday hosted a reception at the People's Palace of Culture in connection with the start of the 3G Mobile Communication Service.
					 Present there on invitation were members of the delegation of the Orascom Telecom Holding of Egypt headed by its Chairman and CEO Naguib Sawiris and Ismail Abdelrahman Ghoneim Hussein, Egyptian ambassador to the DPRK, and diplomatic envoys of different countries here.
					
					 Present there were Ro Tu Chol, vice-premier of the DPRK Cabinet, Ryu Yong Sop, minister of Post and Telecommunication, Pak Myong Chol, director of the DPRK Post and Telecommunication Company, and officials concerned.
					
					 Speeches were made at the reception to be followed by an art performance.

articles.title: Letter of Thanks to Kim Jong Il from Egyptian Businessman
articles.content:
Letter of Thanks to Kim Jong Il from Egyptian Businessman
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a letter of thanks from Naguib Sawiris, chairman and CEO of the Orascom Telecom Holding of Egypt, who left here on Tuesday.
					He in his letter noted that he visited the DPRK with the boundless respect and reverence for
						 Kim Jong Il who has led the Korean people to victory with his unique Songun politics and encouraged the people of developing countries.
					
					 He stressed that during his visit he was impressed to see the Korean people struggling to build a great prosperous powerful nation, rallied close around Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He expressed deep thanks to Kim Jong Il for his attention to the visit of the delegation.

articles.title: Congratulations to Swiss President
articles.content:
Congratulations to Swiss President
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a congratulatory message to Hans Rudolf Merz on Dec. 16 on his election as President of Switzerland.
					 In the message, Kim wholeheartedly wished the president success in his work for the prosperity of his country and welfare of the people.

articles.title: DPRK, Czech Republic Cooperate in Education
articles.content:
DPRK, Czech Republic Cooperate in Education
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- A 2008-2011 agreement on exchange and cooperation in education between the DPRK Ministry of Education and the Ministry of Education, Youth and Sports of the Czech Republic was signed at the People's Palace of Culture on Tuesday.
					Present at the signing ceremony from the DPRK side were Ryang Hak Sun, vice-minister of Education, and officials concerned and from the opposition side Martin Tomco, Czech ambassador to the DPRK, and a staff member of his embassy.
					
					 The agreement was inked by Ryang Hak Sun and Martin Tomco.

articles.title: Successes in Medicine Research
articles.content:
Successes in Medicine Research
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- The Pharmaceutical Research Institute under the Academy of Medical Science of the DPRK has of late developed a new method for manufacturing Panaxadiol Injection which is used as aphoxide.
					 The injection, the strong immunological enhancement medicine, controls propagation of cancer cells and prevents cancer from metastasizing.
					
					 It not only prevents leucopenia and improves immunological function of human beings but also is efficacious for controlling aging and treating autonomic imbalance and arteriosclerosis.
					
					 Its production technology was highly appreciated at the 11th national exhibition of scientific and technical achievements in the field of public health held in Pyongyang.
					
					 Meanwhile, the research team has registered many achievements in their intensified researches into the extraction and standardization of Koryo medicines in line with the developing trend of modern medical science.
					
					 In particular, the researchers there have succeeded in the extraction of Paedoksan, a typical Koryo medicine made with various medicinal stuffs.
					
					 The success in the extraction of Paedoksan makes it possible to ensure the thorough hygienic security of Koryo medicines and opens a bright vista for raising treatment efficacy and putting their production and dosage on a scientific basis.

articles.title: Development of Juche-oriented Literature and Art Displayed
articles.content:
Development of Juche-oriented Literature and Art Displayed
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Juche 97 (2008) has witnessed a striking display of daily efflorescing and developing Juche-oriented literature and art.
					The 1st National Art Festival Commemorating the Day of the Sun was held with splendor to gratify the unanimous desire of the entire Korean people to hold President Kim Il Sung always in high esteem.
					
					 Working people of all strata, to say nothing of professional artistes, put on the festival stage colorful programs of new themes high in ideological standard with their refined artistic skill so as to vividly illustrate the fresh aspects of ever-flourishing Songun culture.
					
					 Masterpieces stirring the times were created one after another in musical art.
					
					"Song of Loyalty", a song of praise sung by the whole people, and such songs as "Motherland, Prosper", "I'll Be the Flower to Herald the Spring", "Desire of Soldier", "Song of Chollima Forerunner" and "Snow Falls" were given new rendition as masterpieces strongly appealing to people's hearts.
					
					 The Grand Gymnastic and Artistic Performance "Arirang", a treasure of human culture and art, was given before capacity crowds, startling the world.
					
					 The first contest of the second-term of art groups of families of servicepersons of the Korean People's Army, the combined art performance of art groups of ministries and national institutions celebrating the February 16 holiday and the national art performance of war veterans marking the 55th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War displayed the true picture of the involvement of the masses in art activities.
					
					 Many poems including "Let Flag of Our Republic Fly Higher!" depicting the immortal feats of the three generals of Mt. Paektu recorded in the 60-year long history of the DPRK and "Call of Naval Port", "Follow What We Are Doing" and other feature films portraying men of the Songun era were created to pull at the heartstrings of people.
					
					 Lots of fine art works rich in ideological content and artistic value were presented to national art shows including a national art exhibition commemorating the Day of the Sun, which well showed the development of Juche-oriented art.
					
					 Artists of the Mansudae Art Studio presented Korean paintings and porcelain crafts to the 11th Beijing International Art Exposition and the Jingdezhen International Porcelain Fair in China-2008 to be awarded the top prize "Best Art Creation Idea" and diploma, and gold prize. And acrobats were awarded "Gold Prize of Yellow Crane" at the 8th Wuhan International Acrobatics Festival.
					
					 All these achievements are brilliant fruits of the wise leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea on literature and art.

articles.title: U.S. Moves to Launch Another Korean War Assailed
articles.content:
U.S. Moves to Launch Another Korean War Assailed
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- It was disclosed recently that the Command of the U.S. Forces in the Pacific in a "strategic report" deemed it "a top priority task" to cope with "contingency" on the Korean Peninsula.
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday observes in a signed commentary carried in this regard:
					
					 This is a very ill-boding development as it reveals the criminal scenario of the U.S. bellicose forces to round off the U.S.-Japan-south Korea tripartite military alliance and hold a military edge in this area and thus realize their ambition for world domination.
					
					 The U.S. has persistently pushed ahead with its dangerous war scenario to stifle the DPRK by force of arms behind the scene of dialogue, not missing each chance to talk about "peace" on the peninsula. The DPRK can never remain a passive onlooker to this move.
					
					 The facts that the above-said command stressed the importance of knocking into shape the tripartite cooperative system of the U.S., Japan and south Korea in its "strategic report" and there has been a quadruple increase in the number of the U.S. strategic nuclear -powered submarines involved in "guard and observation operations" in the waters of the Pacific suggest a lot of things, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 The building of the so-called U.S.-Japan-south Korea tripartite cooperative system means a tripartite military alliance grouping them.
					
					 By forming the said alliance, the U.S. imperialists seek to bind Japan and south Korea, their war servants, to it more tightly and retain their firm grip on the military strategic edge in this region in a bid to effectively use the alliance as a mechanism for executing their war. The appearance of the above-said tripartite military alliance under this situation would render the situation on the peninsula graver and make the outbreak of another Korean war an established fact. As a matter of fact, the U.S. imperialists have become more frantic in their moves to attain this objective.
					
					 The reality proves once again what a just measure the DPRK has taken to bolster its war deterrent in every way to cope with the evermore undisguised moves of the U.S. imperialists to provoke the war.
					
					 Those who are fond of playing with fire will not escape the fate of a tiger moth, the commentary warns, urging the U.S. to lend an ear to the warning of the DPRK and behave itself.

articles.title: Japan Disqualified to Participate in Six-Party Talks
articles.content:
Japan Disqualified to Participate in Six-Party Talks
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Japan is an uninvited guest and troublemaker as it poked its nose into the six-party talks just to attain its sinister aim. Any wicked troublemaker is bound to be disqualified to participate in any talks.
					Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says this in a signed commentary blasting Japan for talking nonsense as regards the six-party talks.
					
					It goes on:
					
					Japan is working hard to underscore the importance of its presence at the said talks at any cost but this is an impertinent deed.
					
					 Japan has neither qualification nor face to talk about the talks.
					
					It was none other than Japan which overturned even the agreed points without any trouble though they had already been stipulated in the document.
					
					Other parties to the talks are fulfilling their commitments under the October 3 agreement, not regarding it as a burden.
					
					It is only Japan that has doggedly refused to honor its commitment in violation of the agreement.
					
					It not only refused to fulfill its commitment but disturbed other parties to the talks in implementing the agreement overtly and covertly while attending them.
					
					 When the United States was intending to take the DPRK off the list of "state sponsors of terrorism," Japan was busy with diplomacy aimed to persuade and implore the former not to do that. Japan's ulterior aim is to bar the nuclear issue on the Korean Peninsula from being solved and put spurs to the moves to turn it into a military giant under that pretext. It is mean, indeed, for Japan to try to turn the six-party talks into a platform for attaining its selfish aim.
					
					There is no need to allow the above-said troublemaker to sit at the negotiating table any longer as it is seeking an ulterior purpose, impertinently involving itself in the six-party talks.

articles.title: Japan Urged to Drop Its Claim to Tok Islet
articles.content:
Japan Urged to Drop Its Claim to Tok Islet
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Tok Islet will always remain part of the inviolable territory of the Korean nation, says Minju Joson Tuesday in a signed commentary.
					 It goes on:
					
					 A document recently discovered in Hamada History Museum, Shimane Prefecture, Japan, reportedly says that in the 19th century Japan recognized Tok Islet as part of Korea's territory as evidenced by its punishment of a Japanese fisherman who sailed to the islet on the charge of violation of the "Ordinance Banning Sailing to the Islet."
					
					 The document provides one more material evidence proving that the islet has long remained part of the inalienable territory of Korea, once again giving the lie before the world to the Japanese reactionaries' assertion calling for "dominion over the islet."
					
					 Japan has admitted the fact that Tok Islet belongs to Korea from a historic point of view and there are more evidence proving this. The issue of Tok Islet, therefore, admits of no argument.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries' moves to seize Tok Islet have reached an extreme phase today.
					
					 They are leaving no means untried to persistently assert "dominium over Tok Islet." The ulterior aim sought by them through this is obviously to infuse the ambition to grab the islet into the Japanese in a bid to kick up a whirlwind for overseas aggression in the Japanese society and create environment and preconditions favorable for staging a comeback to Korea.
					
					The Japanese reactionaries' undisguised moves to grab the islet are a wanton violation of the sovereignty of the Korean nation and a challenge to it.
					
					 No matter how desperately the Japanese reactionaries may insist that Tok Islet belongs to Japan, it can never become part of the territory of Japan.

articles.title: GNP Accused of Pushing Inter-Korean Relations to Total Severance
articles.content:
GNP Accused of Pushing Inter-Korean Relations to Total Severance
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, Pak Hui Thae, representative of the Grand National Party of south Korea, went so ridiculous as to praise the ultra-right conservative organizations that scattered leaflets and incited confrontation with the north as the organizations which "endeavored" for someone's "human rights" and "democracy" and appreciate their "patriotic devotion."
					 Leading newspapers Tuesday in signed commentaries dismiss what Pak uttered as reckless remarks that touch off bitter resentment among the people.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun says:
					
					 Pak went the lengths of embellishing what was done by the above-said organizations as "patriotic devotion" though the inter-Korean relations are inching close to collapse due to the provocative scattering of leaflets by confrontational maniacs who hurt fellow countrymen like mad dogs. This suffices to reveal his true colors as a traitor hell-bent on confrontation.
					
					 The commentary cites facts to prove that this guy is nothing but a disgusting anti-DPRK maniac and traitor to the nation as he is to blame for bedeviling the inter-Korean relations.
					
					 It is deplorable, indeed, that such man who knows nothing but painting treachery as patriotism is allowed to remain in the political camp in south Korea, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 The north-south relations are festering as the days go by, far from getting rid of the present crisis, as traitor Lee Myung Bak has around him many confrontational maniacs such as Pak Hui Thae.
					
					Minju Joson warns that the army and people of the DPRK will surely settle accounts with the GNP gentries who have deteriorated the inter-Korean relations by using human scum as a shock brigade for fanning up the confrontation with fellow countrymen.

articles.title: Dynamic Drive for Building Economic Power Called for
articles.content:
Dynamic Drive for Building Economic Power Called for
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Dynamic progress in the economic construction would help ensure political independence of the country, lay a solid material foundation for increasing national defence capacity and provide people with better conditions for a highly civilized material and cultural life, says Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in a signed article.
					 The DPRK has demonstrated before the world its might as a political and ideological power as well as a military power despite the complicated situation and trials. This would have been unthinkable without the wise guidance of the Workers' Party of Korea which has always directed big efforts to the economic construction, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 To dynamically push forward the drive to build an economic power is an important work to reinforce the faith of all the people that the Korean-style socialist system is best, and it provides a material guarantee for increasing the defence capacity of the country.
					
					 Political independence is the life and soul of the independent and sovereign country and this is firmly guaranteed by self-supporting economy. Political independence not backed by self-supporting economy would be no more than an empty talk.
					
					 Only when the people dynamically step up the drive to build an economic power in the general advance for the Songun revolution, is it possible to consolidate the material and economic foundation of Korean-style socialism. Only then the DPRK would demonstrate more strikingly its dignity as a socialist state strong in Juche character.
					
					 The WPK advanced policies for drastically improving the standard of the people's living and has wisely led the struggle to implement them, invariably enforcing socialist policies despite difficulties just as it did for the past more than decade.
					
					 The people's support and trust in the DPRK government have become undisputed as it has looked after their destiny in a responsible manner.
					
					 If the DPRK consolidates its economic foundation through a dynamic drive for building an economic power, it will turn into an invulnerable fortress in the true sense of the word, concludes the article.

articles.title: Suppression of Teachers Protested in S. Korea
articles.content:
Suppression of Teachers Protested in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions issued a statement on Dec. 12 in protest against the puppet authorities' unjust suppression of teachers under the south Korean Teachers' Union.
					 The statement charged that on Dec. 10 the Seoul City Education Office dismissed seven teachers of the union on unreasonable charges, regarding their right actions as hindrance to implementing the authorities' improper education policy.
					
					 Such suppression is a politically-motivated vicious retaliation to the union, it said, adding: To force the people to unconditionally accept the above-said policy, which has been rejected by the large majority of the population, is behavior that can be made only by a dictatorial regime.
					
					 Teachers of the union can never be a target of suppression, the statement said, urging the authorities to immediately revoke the dismissal.
					
					 It held that the Lee Myung Bak "government" and the Seoul City Education Office should stop the moves to revise history textbooks and all attempts to crack down upon the union.

articles.title: GNP's Move to Railroad Budget Bill through NA Assailed in S. Korea
articles.content:
GNP's Move to Railroad Budget Bill through NA Assailed in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- The People's Council for Welfare and Democracy of south Korea called a press conference outside the building of the "Grand National Party" on Dec. 12 demanding an immediate stop to the move to railroad an unpopular budget bill through the "National Assembly".
					 Speakers at the press conference charged that the budget bill which the GNP is working so hard to ram through the NA that day utterly disregarded the people's living.
					
					 They demanded the GNP withdraw it at once and take measures for stabilizing the people's life.
					
					 If the GNP persistently railroads the budget bill through the NA, it will face a stern judgment of the people, they warned.
					
					 On the same day the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions, the Solidarity for Progress of south Korea and other organizations held a meeting in Youido of Seoul denouncing the move of the traitorous political party.
					
					 The Democratic Labor Party of south Korea also called a press conference inside the "National Assembly" at which it blasted the GNP's wrong attitude and vowed to struggle against it to the last.

articles.title: Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il Praised in Mexico
articles.content:
Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il Praised in Mexico
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- The Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism published the 16th issue of its bulletin on the occasion of the 17th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's assumption of supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army.
					 The bulletin carried an article titled " Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il and the Korean People's Army" illustrated with a photograph of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il standing together.
					
					 It said in the article that the KPA has demonstrated its might as reliable defender of the socialist cause, frustrating every challenge of the imperialists, and further trained itself to be an army strong in ideology and faith under the care of Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Under his guidance the KPA has grown to be an army strong in ideology and faith, the army which is full of the spirit of devotedly defending the leader and ready to unhesitatingly go through thick and thin for the country and the people, and developed into invincible ranks perfectly equipped with modern military technique, the bulletin noted.
					
					 The DPRK recently built up even powerful war deterrent any formidable imperialist enemy dare not attack, it said, stressing: The KPA under the command of Kim Jong Il will always emerge victorious as an invincible army.

articles.title: Abierto en Corea el Banco Ora
articles.content:
Abierto en Corea el Banco Ora
Pyongyang, 16 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 16 en esta capital la ceremonia de apertura del Banco Ora.
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes el presidente del Banco Comercial de Corea O Kwang Chol, el viceministro de Finanzas Sin Pong Ryol, el director del Banco Nacional Kim Chon Gyun, el vicepresidente del Banco Ora Ri Yong Su, y otros funcionarios coreanos, los miembros de la delegacion de la Compania de Telecomunicacion Orascom de Egipto encabezada por su director general Naguib Sawiris, el embajador egipcio en Corea, Ismail Abdelrahman Ghoneim Hussein, y el presidente del Banco Ora Ezzeldin Heikal.
					
					Al hacer uso de la palabra, O Kwang Chol dijo que la apertura del Banco Ora es un producto de la cooperacion entre el Banco Comercial de Corea y la Compania de Telecomunicacion Orascom de Egipto y anadio que el nuevo banco contribuira en lo adelante a fortalecer la amistad y a desarrollar la cooperacion entre los dos paises.
					
					Naguib Sawiris formulo su deseo de que el Banco Ora haga aporte a la comprension y al desarrollo de las relaciones de amistad entre los pueblos de Egipto y Corea.

articles.title: Firmado acuerdo de intercambio y cooperacion Corea-Checo
articles.content:
Firmado acuerdo de intercambio y cooperacion Corea-Checo
Pyongyang, 16 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Quedo rubricado este martes en el capitalino Palacio Cultural del Pueblo el acuerdo sobre el intercambio y cooperacion en la rama docente para el periodo 2008-2011 entre el Ministerio de Educacion de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y el Ministerio de Educacion, Juventud y Deportes de la Republica Checa.
					En la ceremonia de firmas estuvieron presentes por la parte coreana la viceministra de Educacion Ryang Hak Sun y otros funcionarios, y por la checa, el embajador Martin Tomco y un miembro de la sede diplomatica checa en Corea.
					
					Ryang Hak Sun y Martin Tomco suscribieron el documento.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun condena intencion belicista de EE.UU. contra RPDC
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun condena intencion belicista de EE.UU. contra RPDC
Pyongyang, 16 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Recientemente, la comandancia general de las tropas norteamericanas en el Pacifico definio en su "informe estrategico" la "reaccion" frente al "tiempo de emergencia" de la Peninsula Coreana como la "tarea mas prioritaria".
					Este sospechoso acontecimiento es la expresion de la intencion criminal de las fuerzas belicistas norteamericanas de tomar la hegemonia militar en esa area al perfeccionar la alianza militar tripartita junto con Japon y el Sur de Corea y realizar valiendose de ella su ambicion de dominar el mundo.
					
					Asi senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual difundido en su edicion de este martes y continua:
					
					La RPDC no puede estar con brazos cruzados ante el hecho de que EE.UU. impulsa de continuo, detras de la cortina del dialogo, su peligroso plan de provocar la guerra para aplastarla militarmente hablando paradojicamente de la "preservacion de la paz" en la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					El referido "informe estrategico" enfatizo la importancia del establecimiento del sistema de cooperacion tripartita entre EE.UU., Japon y Sur de Corea mientras se cuadriplico el porcentaje de los submarinos nucleares estrategicos de EE.UU. participantes en las misiones de "vigilancia" en el Mar Pacifico. Estos hechos insinuan muchas cosas.
					
					El establecimiento del sistema de cooperacion tripartita significa la construccion de la alianza militar tripartita, a la cual EE.UU. intenta atar mas a sus seguidores (Japon y el Sur de Corea) al servicio de su estrategia belicista.
					
					De esta manera, pretende consolidar sus ventajas estrategico-militares en esa region y utilizar eficazmente la alianza tripartita como aparato de guerra.
					
					Por lo tanto, el perfeccionamiento de la alianza militar tripartita agravara la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana y hara realidad la segunda guerra coreana, que ya es un hecho consumado para EE.UU.
					
					La realidad vuelve a corroborar cuan justa es la medida de la RPDC de fortalecer por todos los medios su disuasivo de guerra frente a las cada dia mas abiertas maniobras de EE.UU. para provocar la nueva guerra coreana.
					
					Los que prefieren fuego mueren quemados en ello.
					
					EE.UU. debe actuar con prudencia escuchando atentamente la advertencia de la RPDC.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun insiste en excluir a Japon de la cita seis-partita
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun insiste en excluir a Japon de la cita seis-partita
Pyongyang, 16 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Japon es el intruso que se metio en las conversaciones a 6 bandas solo para satisfacer sus objetivos malsanos. Naturalmente, este estropeador malvado sera desclasificado tarde o temprano para la cita seis-partita.
					Senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual divulgado este martes con motivo de que Japon difunde unos rumores voluntariosos y de mal genio en cuanto a las conversaciones a 6 partes.
					
					Japon maniobra atrevida y desesperadamente para dar destaque a su presencia en esa cita, comienza el comentarista y prosigue:
					
					Pero, este pais isleno no tiene calificacion ni cara para hablar de ese dialogo multilateral porque convierte en letra muerta, sin pensarlo dos veces, los puntos acordados oficializados en el documento.
					
					Los demas participantes cumplen sus deberes correspondientes segun el Acuerdo del 3 de Octubre sin considerarlos como cargas.
					
					Japon es el unico que niega obstinadamente el cumplimiento de su deber dando espaldas al acuerdo referido.
					
					Lo peor del caso es que este pais obstaculizo de una manera u otra el cumplimiento de los compromisos de los demas participantes.
					
					A citar un ejemplo, cuando EE.UU. iba a eliminar a la RPDC de la lista de los "paises que apoyan el terrorismo", Japon habia lanzado una campana persuasiva para impedirlo. La verdadera intencion del pais isleno reside en estorbar la solucion del problema nuclear de la Peninsula Coreana y dar acicate, tomandolo por pretexto, a la conversion de su pais en una potencia militar.
					
					Es muy sucia la conducta de Japon que trata de aprovechar las conversaciones a 6 bandas como espacio para alcanzar sus ambiciones egoistas.
					
					Es innecesario que este estorbador siga presente en la mesa de dicho dialogo.

articles.title: Periodicos denuncian al "GPN" del Sur de Corea
articles.content:
Periodicos denuncian al "GPN" del Sur de Corea
Pyongyang, 16 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Hace poco, el representante del "Gran Partido Nacional" del Sur de Corea, Pak Hui Thae, elogio a las entidades conservadoras ultraderechistas, que fomentan la confrontacion intercoreana que recurren brutalmente al lanzamiento de volantes de contenido anti-RPDC, diciendo que ellas "se esforzaron" por los "DDHH" y "la democracia" de alguien y son "patrioticas y fieles al pais".
					Los periodicos capitalinos publicaron este martes sendos comentarios individuales destacando que tal disparate grosero de Pak hace estallar en colera a todos los connacionales.
					
					Debido al provocativo lanzamiento de volantes por parte de los maniacos de confrontacion, que hacen danos a los connacionales como perros rabiosos, van de mal en peor las relaciones entre ambas partes coreanas, senala el diario Rodong Sinmun y prosigue:
					
					Por lo tanto, el hecho de que Pak califico esa infamia de la supuesta "fidelidad al pais y patriotismo" basta para conocer su antinacional concepcion conflictiva con el Norte.
					
					Es evidente que este sucio maniaco anti-RPDC y traidor a la nacion, que llevo a la ruptura las relaciones N-S, considera la traicion como el patriotismo.
					
					Es una realidad vergonzosa que ese tipejo anduviera libremente en el suelo surcoreano haciendose el politico.
					
					Las relaciones N-S se tornan cada dia mas catastroficas, lejos de salir de la crisis actual, por culpa de los elementos partidarios de confrontacion de la calana de Pak que pululan al lado del traidor Lee Myung Bak.
					
					Por su parte, el periodico Minju Joson subraya que el ejercito y el pueblo de la RPDC ajustaran sin falta la cuenta de los crimenes de la banda del "GPN" que empeora las relaciones Norte-Sur poniendo a las escorias humanas al frente de la campana de enfrentamiento fratricida.
